availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Harrison Randall (London, Kentucky attorney, clerk, politician)

body.p: London, Kentucky attorney, clerk, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Jane Randall. Father of Richard Randall, Julia Randall, William H. Randall, Jr., James S. Randall, Sarah “Sallie” E. Randall, and Charles M. Randall. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1835. Practiced law in London. Laurel Circuit Court clerk and Laurel County clerk from 1836 to 1851. Attorney and law partner of Judge Robert Boyd in London in 1863. Member of the United States House of Representatives from the Eighth Congressional District of Kentucky as an Unconditional Unionist from 1863 to 1867. Delegate to the National Union Party Convention at Baltimore, Maryland, in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, p. 12A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, London, p. 473.

Charles Lanman, Biographical Annals of the Civil Government of the United States (Washington: J. M. Morrison, 1887), 410.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 559.
